update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

~~The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.~~ merged and simbody test integrated

For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

content.raw:
No, there is no added value in adding such values.

That is why the `Preset::SetParam` function is (or should be) hidden from the user, while the `PresetManager::SetProfileParam` is exposed to the user. As I stated in the above post, the public `PresetManager::SetProfileParam` function will check for keys that are defined in SDF.
content.html:
No, there is no added value in adding such values.

That is why the Preset::SetParam function is (or should be) hidden from the user, while the PresetManager::SetProfileParam is exposed to the user. As I stated in the above post, the public PresetManager::SetProfileParam function will check for keys that are defined in SDF.

content.raw: Check that `_profileName` exists first.
content.html: Check that _profileName exists first.

content.raw: Check that `name` exists first.
content.html: Check that name exists first.

content.raw: It looks like `currentPreset` is a pointer to an element in the `presetProfiles` map. It would be better to have `currentPreset` be a key (`std::string`) into the `presetProfiles` map.
content.html: It looks like currentPreset is a pointer to an element in the presetProfiles map. It would be better to have currentPreset be a key (std::string) into the presetProfiles map.

content.raw:
Is there value to setting a parameter whose key will not be used by the physics engine?

For example, should we allow: `SetParam('my_unused_parameter', 24);`?
content.html:
Is there value to setting a parameter whose key will not be used by the physics engine?

For example, should we allow: SetParam('my_unused_parameter', 24);?

content.raw:
How about this:

`Preset::SetParam` allows any key to be set (stays as is)

`PresetManager::SetProfileParam` only sets the parameter if the key exists in the map (needs to change)

When initializing a profile from SDF, invoke `Preset::SetParam`.

Thus we expect only parameters that exist in SDF to ever get set in the parameter map.
content.html:
How about this:

Preset::SetParam allows any key to be set (stays as is)

PresetManager::SetProfileParam only sets the parameter if the key exists in the map (needs to change)

When initializing a profile from SDF, invoke Preset::SetParam.

Thus we expect only parameters that exist in SDF to ever get set in the parameter map.

content.raw: Do you want to check if the key exists before setting?
content.html: Do you want to check if the key exists before setting?

update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.

For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.

For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

content.raw: A single for loop without recursion will only traverse one level of the SDF tree. SDF physics elements can be nested up to 3 levels (e.g. `<physics> <ode> <solver>< <iters/> /solver> </ode> </physics>`). I had previously implemented it this way, but it didn't find SDF elements below direct children of <physics>. I could rewrite this as a loop with a depth limit if needed.
content.html: A single for loop without recursion will only traverse one level of the SDF tree. SDF physics elements can be nested up to 3 levels (e.g. <physics> <ode> <solver>< <iters/> /solver> </ode> </physics>). I had previously implemented it this way, but it didn't find SDF elements below direct children of <physics>. I could rewrite this as a loop with a depth limit if needed.

content.raw:
The jenkins coverage build isn't working right now, so I'm doing a coverage build on my machine (see pull request #1047 for details). I'm guessing the `PresetManager` could use a unit test.
~~~
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage
make
make coverage
firefox coverage/index.html
~~~
content.html:
The jenkins coverage build isn't working right now, so I'm doing a coverage build on my machine (see pull request #1047 for details). I'm guessing the PresetManager could use a unit test.

mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage
make
make coverage
firefox coverage/index.html

content.raw: `bool ProfileParam(profileName, _key, _value)` is the function that calls `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. It false if `PhysicsEngine::SetParam` returns false, etc.
content.html: bool ProfileParam(profileName, _key, _value) is the function that calls PhysicsEngine::SetParam. It false if PhysicsEngine::SetParam returns false, etc.

content.raw: Currently the implementation of this function has no error checking, it just sets an arbitrary key and assigns the input value. However, I could change the API for the future of this function where we only accept physics parameters.
content.html: Currently the implementation of this function has no error checking, it just sets an arbitrary key and assigns the input value. However, I could change the API for the future of this function where we only accept physics parameters.

content.raw: Indeed, that would really fit with future visions for Physics library `GetParam`s. Alas, we didn't think of that in the design document stage. Should I change it here?
content.html: Indeed, that would really fit with future visions for Physics library GetParams. Alas, we didn't think of that in the design document stage. Should I change it here?

content.raw: Does this need to be recursive? Can it just be a loop?
content.html: Does this need to be recursive? Can it just be a loop?
